td.content: s:white male drill instructor aged 25 years presents with increased moderate dyspnea, moderate cough and moderate shortness of breath over 9 months. o:Height 162 cm, Weight 90.8 kg, Temperature 36.6 C, Pulse 79, SystolicBP 104, DiastolicBP 63, Respiration 15, wheeze-LU, wheeze-BIL, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, crackles-LL a:Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed Theophylline - 100 mg 4xday, and ordered FEV1, FEV1/FVC, Pulse Oximetry, Chest X-Ray.

Value.Value: ordered FEV 1 , FEV 1/FVC , Pulse Oximetry , Chest X - Ray

content2.Value: ordered FEV 1 , FEV 1/FVC , Pulse Oximetry , Chest X - Ray

td.content: s:a white male drill instructor aged 27 years presents with progressive severe fever, severe cough, severe shortness of breath and Respiratory for past 7 weeks. he does not smoke consumes more than 4 alcoholic drinks daily o:Height 163 cm, Weight 94.4 kg, Temperature 36.7 C, Pulse 74, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 75, Respiration 16, CT Chest demonstrates areas of centriacinar emphysema, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, actively coughing with sputum production - dark yellow, Neck = no JVD a:Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease p:administered Prednisone - 20 mg orally, performed CT Chest, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
